description: This course is centered around three 19th-century British novels: Mary Shelley's
Frankenstein, R. L. Stevenson's Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde, and Bram Stoker's
Dracula. Students explore the influence of these texts on mythical monsters from the
20th to 21st centuries in the form of classic black and  white films of the 1930s,as well as more
recent fictional and filmic incarnations. What do monsters tell readers about  themselves?
Assignments include both critical and creative writing. Prerequisite: FYW.  Offered occasionally
fullname: Monster: Myths and Movies from the 19th to 21st Centuries
